STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 29, 2023
Michelle Zalewski
Samaritas- Refugee
1545 Keystone Ave,
Lansing, MI, 48911-4039
RE: License#: CB330201264
Dear Ms. Zalewski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/28/23. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Variance- The agency was advised to contact their accreditation authority,
Council On Accreditation (COA) or Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR)
regarding a variance for some of their rules that are stricter that DCWL rules for
foster homes. If a variance is not approved by COA or ORR, a variance for
DCWL rules will be considered.
• Annual foster home evaluations need to be completed by the renewal date of the
off year. For example, if the license expires 9/4/24, the annual is due by 9/4/23.
• Special Evaluations- Documents related to the Special Evaluations must be
uploaded to the document section of CWLM. This includes items required by rule
327, such as notifications to foster care worker and foster parents.
• Employee files- A copy of the job description must be located in the file. An
acknowledgment by the worker that they have viewed the job description does
not meet this requirement.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed on-site. The
Chief Administrator (CA) reported the agency is still very involved in addressing
COVID with the refugee population they serve. Positive cases and isolation
continue to affect some timelines to complete tasks with youth. The agency
continues to use phone, email, and video chat, to complete some tasks as they
are able. The CA also identified a barrier with providing medical care to youth, due
to the type of insurance they have. There are limited providers that accept their
insurance. Therefore, scheduling appointments has been difficult. In addition,
many youth are teenagers or young adults and sometimes forget or refuse to
attend appointments. Another area that has been challenging is staffing shortage.
Cases have been reassigned in order to maintain compliance. However, turnover
has created some difficulty in meeting required timeframes. The CA also noted
there has been a delay with court, due to immigration attorney reassignments and
special findings orders. This is an ongoing issue due to federal changes regarding
immigration. Despite these challenges, the CA indicated the agency is working
hard to maintain compliance. The agency did not have a Corrective Action Plan
from the 2022 review. However, they continue to utilize previous activities that
have assisted in maintaining compliance. A quality improvement team meets
monthly to discuss solutions to barriers. The Unaccompanied Refugee Minor team
meets bi-weekly to review case compliance. Trainings are occurring frequently
with staff to ensure everyone is updated on changing policies.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One staff was interviewed on-site. They reported being satisfied with their position
at the agency. Their supervisor is supportive, hard-working and helpful. There
were no concerns reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in an office building in Lansing. The office
has adequate space for staff to work or meet with clients. There is sufficient locked
storage for files and sensitive information.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable. This is a non-contracted facility.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
_ __________August 29, 2023__________________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 29, 2023

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
